Reviews.Title: “Good - but could find better in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: theflyingbadger
Reviews.Content: As the name suggests, Gat Point Charlie is near Check Point Charlie, a busy and tourist saturated part of Berlin, although the hotel itself is situated on a quieter street. The hotel is new, modern, and very clean. Our room was very spacious, with a large bathroom, and plenty of space to spread your 'stuff' out. There is free WIFI and also a freely accessible computer in reception where the staff will also print for you. If breakfast is not included in your room rate, forget it! At 15EUR per person, it is a complete rip-off. You can eat lunch or dinner for two with drinks and starters for that price. Also, the bedding is quite cheap and uncomfortable (ok for a night, but not 3 or 4). Overall, it is good value and solid 3 start hotel, however there are better parts of Berlin to stay where you should find equal, if not better value.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: missg09
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just 2 mins walk to Checkpoint Charlie and Stadmitte metro stop. The hotel is situated in a quiet square so there was no traffic noise. Had a room overlooking the square on the 6th floor, with a view of the Fernsehturm (TV Tower). The room was compact, modern and clean, the bathroom too. There was a safe in the room, plasma TV, desk and a small hanging space and shelves for your clothes. The staff were helpful and friendly. Didn't have the breakfast as 12 euros seemed a bit pricey when there are other places nearby. Nice touch with the Korres toiletries. I paid 68 euros a night, which I think is a fair price for a room in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet stay in Stadtmitte.”
Reviews.Author: bemoenk
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided us with at pleasing stay. We had no trouble sleeping in the big, comfortable bed in such a quiet room. The staff was all over very nice and helpful. The hotel is located a short walk from U-bahn-stop Stadtmitte, which operates both line 2 and 6.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ElGales
Reviews.Content: The front of house when we arrived was not exactly welcoming and gave us a key for a normal room when we had ordered a suite. She wasn't exactly apologetic when we had to lug our lugguage back down and mention we had ordered a suite. We got the distinct impression it was a ruse she'd not got away with. It was a very bad start. But pretty much from then on, things got better. The suite was a lot bigger than the normal room and actually good value for what we paid. The location is pretty much perfect and everything is brand new if perhaps not so functional (the "hangers" are pieces of wood in the right shape - but completely useless) and a little Ikea chic. There are various cat jokes about the place (our room - 416 - had a broken open bird cage with feather stencils on the nearby paintwork). Not our thing, but gives the place a bit of character I suppose. Our checkout was the opposite to our checkin - much more what we were expecting from the start. On the whole, we enjoyed our stay there and I'd go again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient simplistic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJontheroad2011
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal from booking.com at 61 euros a night for a superior double room, so it is a good idea to watch out for deals! Staff at reception desk are eager to help and are conversational in English. A bit of a problem during check-in as the staff could not find our booking at first even with provision of proof of booking. Was glad that they found it eventually though, but we thought that was a bit odd because it should have been in the system. The room furnitures are simplistic but functional. The shampoos provided by this hotel are of very good quality. I especially liked the hair shampoo containing aloe, it made my hair very smooth! Funny that the shower stall has no shower curtain. So no matter how hard you may try to adjust the angle of the shower head, you are bound to get the floor wet. The absence of a glass door or curtain baffles me. It has been brought up before that the hangers installed on the shelf are almost unusable. For us it was not a problem. In fact we found it good for hanging jackets. The best part about this hotel is its proximity to Stadtmitte and a few main sights. Being close to Stadtmitte means that you are only minutes away from all other sights along the U/S-bahn lines as Stadtmitte is very well-connected. I would recommend this hotel to tourists who need a clean, functional, convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jquinn887
Reviews.Content: Came in mid-march. Quite simple to get to from Tegel Airport. At Tegel just go to the counter where they sell the u-bahn tickets and try to know in advance which station you would like to get to, Stadtmitte. They will tell you which bus to take, I believe 128 which you take to Kurt-Schumaker Platz. Here you get on the U6 line in the Alt-Mariendorf direction, and get off at Stadtmitte where you walk about 2-3 blocks to Hotel GPC. Checked-in quite late but this was no problem. The area is quiet and we felt very safe here, freidrichstrasse is quite a popular and high end street that is just one street over and makes it easy to track down the hotel. Room was somewhat small, but exactly what we needed with a double-bed, tv, free wireless internet, safe in room and bathroom with many soaps, blowdryer and hot water. I would ignore the complaints about the green lights on windows, these did not bother us at all, and the shades on the window can easily block out the green lights if it is a problem. The green lights go off late at night anyways. My reservation included breakfast (I would recommend checking all hotel websites to find the best deal, I believe I found mind through agoda) and I was very glad that it was included. Breakfast was served in the morning and I did enjoy it. Many pastries to choose from, ham, cheese, you could make your own pressed sandwich, they also had potatoes, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage or you could boil your own egg, unfortunately, I could never get mine just right. This breakfast was perfect to start off the day and saved us some money, especially since the reservation was perhaps $10-20 more than one on other websites which excluded breakfast. The only slip might be lack of a refrigerator of sorts. We would get thirsty later in the night and after the first night, where we paid 5 euro for two 0.2 liter sodas (which i didnt even know existed), we made sure to bring back bottled drinks. The cold weather made up for lack of refrigeration, although the room was never cold but we were able to keep the windows open and have the drinks stay cool. Overall, great location, very close to checkpoint charlie, brandenburg gate, potsdamer platz, topography of terror and the holocaust memorial. We did much walking and in our 4 days here only purchased a U-bahn ticket once which was just to get from KaDeWe back to Potsdamer Platz in time for a show. Definitely recommend you stay here for the location, price, and if you get breakfast included I do not think you will have anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, neon downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: BayBoater
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute train ride to Berlin for the weekend with two friends for sightseeing, and wanted mainly a place to sleep within walking distance to a bus tour company and some of the sights. Found Hotel Gat Point Charlie on line with a reasonable price and pretty good reviews. I was a bit surprised when the taxi dropped us off at the entrance to an alley. But, it was a clean, wide, well lit "alley". The entrance, lobby and rooms were brightly lit with neon and a bright green color that might turn some people off. The room was small, but fairly comfortable and clean, The place didn't appear to be many years old. The location was great, two blocks fro Checkpoint Charlie and a stop for the double-decker tour bus we spent most of Saturday on, stopping from time to time to view sights and eat. There are quite a few coffee shops within a few blocks, and taxi service was very quick.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but could try harder!”
Reviews.Author: kirstyboo79
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Gat Point Charlie is great - just round the corner from Checkpoint Charlie and the Topography of Terror and close to U-bahn stops. It can be easily accessed from the airports and from it you can make your way without to much trouble to the various delights Berlin has to offer, be these tourist sights or nightspots. The hotel had a deal on at the time of our booking which meant it was a lower price than usual, so we treated ourselves to a superior double room. The hotel was stylishly decorated (although we found the big green eye logo a little odd!) but if our room was a superior double, I can't imagine how a standard double would be furnished! We felt the name of the room suggested a certain level of luxury which was not present. We had a kingsize bed which was fab, and the look of the room, with the gorgeous lighting features, was great. The room was a big size, but the size didn't seem to be well used. There was a large gap behind the door which could have easily held a wardrobe, which would have been a huge benefit! The funky-looking clothes rails had fixed non-moveable hangers on them which were fairly useless, and those plus the shelves were insufficient storage for two fashionistas travelling to a capital city! We ended up with all our clothes draped over the chairs! Directly opposite the door as you entered the room was a small wooden thing on the wall - I'm struggling to know what to call it but have included a photo with the review - that didn't seem to have any purpose whatsoever, either practical or aesthetic. It would have looked better to have a map of the city on the wall as they do in the reception area, or to have left the wall bare. There were two chairs in the room, but one was a plastic 'school chair' and one an uncomfortable reclined armchair with no lower back support; which was particularly disappointing as I had let the hotel know in advance that I have a torn disc in my back and needed good and comfortable seating! Neither of us could use either chair and ended up sitting on our bed propped up against the pillows whenever we were in the room - which was comfy, but not ideal - and not what you expect from a superior room! The complimentary toiletries are a nice touch, and you can request extra towels (which we needed). The lighting in the actual shower itself isn't great, and the blind in the bathroom doesn't fit the window; also they only provide one glass even when two people are staying. The room was lovely and quiet when we checked in, but the next day we could hear (quite loudly) the sounds of children running around and shouting and squealing, which woke me up! The hotel's location does mean it's set back from the nearby main street though, so other than fellow guests, we weren't disturbed by any other sounds such as traffic. We didn't eat at the hotel (the breakfast was overpriced and the restaurant booths looked trendy but uncomfortable) but we popped into the bar on our last night and the bartender very kindly let us buy some bottles of cava to take upstairs to our room, where we enjoyed them whilst watching German TV! There are plenty of places nearby where you can eat - I especially recommend Sotto Sopra right near Checkpoint Charlie, which is a lovely Italian restaurant with fantastically priced food and really lovely friendly staff. The negative points we picked up on are mainly small things that are minor details individually, but added together could definitely have improved our stay if they were gotten right!

Reviews.Title: “great position!”
Reviews.Author: kikaMamu
Reviews.Content: Great position! 100mt from Checkpoint Charlie, 2 minute from U-bahn!! in the middle of MITTE e very close to Kreutzberg (nigthlife!) The hotel is modern and new! The room essential and very clean (no a real cupboard, but a open one.. a little too small for two people). The rooms are really quit!! Breakfast: we choose not to do it in the hotel 'cause a bit expensive (12 euro)... there are a lot of nice place in Friedrichstrasse, the best is on the corner with Krausenstrasse: full breakfast for 5 euro! Great hotel expecially for youngs!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value design hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: r2rho
Reviews.Content: Nice price, excellent location within walking distance to most locations and easy access to several U-Bahn lines. Clean rooms with modern design, though slightly small. Avoid the pricey breakfast and go to the nice bakery around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a good location for visiting Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Annie3974
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel having researched Berlin hotels on Trip Advisor and was very pleased with my choice. We stayed at the Hotel Gat Point Charlie for 3 nights from 19th- 22nd February 2012. The receptionist was very friendly and welcoming and we were soon checked in to a room next door to our son and girlfriend, who were on the same booking but had arrived a couple of hours earlier. The room was compact but was well appointed for a short stay. The space available for clothes was adequate for a few days, or for those who travel light, but if you have a lot of luggage you might struggle to find space to put it. (There may be larger rooms available for longer stays, I didn't ask.) The bar area was pleasant and we spent an hour or so one evening playing cards there. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, as we thought 15 euros expensive, but there are plenty of places for breakfast in the city. The location was perfect for seeing the sights, in particular it was only a short walk to the beautiful Gendarmenmarkt, and Check Point Charlie and the Judisches Museum are a short walk in the other direction. We would certainly consider staying here again if we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Agreable stay at Fruit Logistica”
Reviews.Author: Rakkertjes
Reviews.Content: nice functional hotel for expo visit. Nice wifi everywhere, fucntional rooms, decent breakfast and nice price. Well situated in the city of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT [avoid the breakfast!]”
Reviews.Author: Massey183
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in early 2011, have to say i loved it, had a suite on the top floor and we couldn't have been happier, rooms were perfect size and the bathroom was great too. Huge tv and free wi fi, what more could you ask for, hotel is in the perfect location for exploring berlin by foot and excellent value too compared to others, However avoid the breakfast at all cost, its highly overpriced and horrible,

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Anna S
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to say, but GREAT value for money! Excellent location, looks and feels brand new, cool modern design. Spacious shower and huuuuge comfy beds. Expensive breakfast? Nobody forces you to have it! Just take a few steps and enjoy all the foodies and goodies in the city center!

Reviews.Title: “Kinda cool!”
Reviews.Author: CjDIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference I was attending in a former coal-fired power station right behind the hotel. I'd descried the hotel as cool and quiet. The hotel has quite a funky design - streamlined and very clever indeed. The bedrooms are a standard shape but I really liked the curvilinear bend ply storage units which have incorporated plywood hangers! The lighting is also very smart. Over the bed there is a backlit abstract photograph and underneath it all the lighting controls are situated. There is a nightlight that illuminates the floor and gives just enough light in the bathroom so you won't be dazzled during the night when you need to use the facilities! Really well thought out. The shower was really great - though controlling the water temperature was tricky. The breakfast was expensive at EURO12 - which you can make the most of if you have a big appetite, but I don't. I would recommend giving breakfast a miss - and heading to the basement of the local Galleria Layafette on Friedrichstraße for a great coffee and croissant! There is a tapas bar on the ground floor which I didn't try but it looked ok. There is a Thai restaurant - which was ok the evening I went there. Most of the recommended Turkish restaurants, which I wanted to try, are a 40 minute walk away! Shopping on Friedrichstrasse is very convenient. In terms of location other than the dearth of good restaurants within reach- Its only a 20 minute walk to Museum Island and Tiergarten. There are a number of metro stations within minutes of the hotel. You can hire bikes at the hotel too. Finally, they have quite cleverly designed universal access which is great - though if you are a wheelchair user I'd say the bedrooms and bathroom in particular are a bit of a squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great design, good price”
Reviews.Author: curious_and_cares
Reviews.Content: Quirky and fun modern design hotel. Even more fun if your favorite color is green. Ideally located close to everything you want to see in Berlin, close to the main streets but set off on a quiet street. Very reasonable price, but we found the restaurant on the expensive side - who cares - there are plenty of other restaurants and bakeries around! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel that makes you happy”
Reviews.Author: estellabelle
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I have stayed at this lovely hotel during our weekend stay in Berlin. There are many great things to say about the place: very centrally located, lovely modern and young design and friendly staff that are all more than refreshing. But the most important thing -which is also very characteristic of the place- is that the design, the colours, the spirits, the mood, and the hospitality add up to a place that makes you truly happy. Soon after we checked in, we noticed that we began to smile unintentionally. That was truly rewarding. The price is value, though I can't possibly say the same for breakfast. Though it's not a problem as there are lots of affordable selections nearby. The next tme I go to Berlin I will stay at Gat Point definitely.. I also would like to add that modern design hotels are not really my style, but happily this was a fortunate surprise... ps. A little criticism though: We booked a double room which was two beds united, therefore not suitable for cuddling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and stay”
Reviews.Author: gaffa04
Reviews.Content: Gat Point Charlie is a great little hotel. It is a bit cheaper than a lot of the other ones but personall for a short city break you cannot really notice the difference. The rooms were clean, tidy and well presented. We even quite like the colour! The hotel is in a great location, stumbling distance from Checkpoint Charlie and most of the attractions are within walking distance. The only small downside was the shower had a tendancy to try its best to scold you, as if someone else was using the water. There was also a fantastic Thai Restaurant a few doors down Sisaket Thai http://www.maothai.de/sisaket.php, where the food and the service was great. (Highly recommended). I would definately stay at the hotel again and the staff were also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: scottravel32
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights in this fantastic modern hotel, literally round the corner from Checkpoint Charlie. Although my single room was small, it was spotlessly clean and had everything I needed for this short break. Staff were very helpful, and the free wifi was a real bonus. Cannot fault it at all.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrst4812
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel after reading the other reviews and completely agree. excellent value for money, helpful staff and a great location. would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very close to perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Statement-dk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Got upgraded to junior suite (sweet). Very central location (but quiet). Everything was new and in a very good condition. Extremely good value for money in this cool hotel. Staff was nice and helpful. Free WiFi and internet! Would sure check this hotel out, next time in Berlin. (only one small small small downside - the only English channel on the tv was CNN - but with free WiFi, we could check the news, etc. on the phone). :-D

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price/quality”
Reviews.Author: cescgp
Reviews.Content: Good design, nice staff, perfect situation, very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for price we paid, but some key flaws that could be easily sorted out”
Reviews.Author: AcsJab85
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights with my boyfriend. I'll start with the good stuff.We paid £175 for the 3 nights which I felt was good value, mainly for where it is. It's location, as a lot of other reviewers have said, is great, and if you're not mad on night life its perfect as its very quiet and there are some good places to eat near by (I can recommend Izumi a small sushi place 5 mins walk away) .The room space was fine for two people but this was a superior double. That said, there was an odd bit of wasted space behind the door and as you came in that seemed quite pointless, but that's their choice. No issues with the cleanliness, could easily ask via the door hanging sign if you wanted your room & towels cleaned.Small lifts, but no problem for us at all as wasn't busy and we never waited for one. We walked everywhere (TV tower, Brandenberg Gate, Alexanderplatz, Tiergarten etc) as we were quite happy to and although after a day it was tiring, it's perfectly possible if the weather is ok. The reception staff were polite but if i'm totally honest I wouldn't go as far to say they were friendly. The hotel restaurant had great food and an excellent waitress who spoke German, Spanish & English and was very quick with orders and helpful with menu advice. Moving on to the bad - the lack of air con was a problem in our room - the window didn't open all that wide and so didn't provide much air flow if any. Trying to get more also meant you had to make a choice whether you wanted to be cooler or have your privacy as you had to pull back the curtains. Another privacy issue that bugged me was that the window blind was essentially see-through and the glass wasn't obscure - when you stepped out of the shower you were therefore clearly visible to the windows on the courtyard area opposite. I booked a superior double with a city view - the view was not of the city, and there were two twin beds instead of one double, so whilst I had no issue with the size of it, the other credentials of the superior double did not live up to how it was advertised. The shower was another bugbear - looked great, but every now and then no matter when I showered and what temp I had it, it went almost boilding hot, for about 15 seconds like someone was flushing the toilet in another room. It was annoying but also painful and is something they really need to look at sorting out. Summary - Worth it for location if you pay a budget price, but needs improvement. Would I go back? Not sure, i'd be more likely to try something new for comparison. Would I recommend? Yes for short stays, no for anything over a week with the current issues.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel. Excellent restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Oguh_85
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very interesting in appearance, and everyone seemed nice enough. However, there are design flaws. The room I stayed in was very hot (I stayed in late October). There was also a strange incident with an employee entering the room after knocking and only giving 5 seconds before opening the door; I'm not quite sure what that was about, and other than a quick apology from the employee, not another word was spoken about that. The restaurant is on a completely different level. The service and food was absolutely fantastic. The quick breakfast buffet was also very good. I can't say much more about it other than you must go if you're in Berlin simply for the food.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: unholywolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gat Point for 4 nights. We are very satisfied. Let's start with the positive things. The hotel is a new structure and it has a nice design. Girls from the reception were very kind taking care of a flower service I requested for my girlfriend. Room was spacious and it had a flat tv screen, I didn't really watched it so I don't know anything about channels. Shower was huge and all the room was very clean. Safety box in the room is also provided. Wifi on the rooms is free of charge and it had a good speed. We loved the picture on the room which has a light behind it so you can create a good ambience. Also there's a night light to go to the bathroom, little and doesn't bother your partner. The position was great, 2 minute walk to stadtmitte station on the U2, it can take you to Alexanderplatz or Potsdamer very easily. There's no nightlife in the area but it's safe to get back to the hotel at night. I didn't like the lack of the fridge on the room, the insanely expensive breakfast (though it's all the same all over Berlin, you can avoid to pay for it as there are plenty of nice bars and restaurant around the area). No thermostat on the room, temperature was ok but what if I was cold or hot? Also, other comments says there's no air con, well, I stayed the on October so no problems for me, I also noticed there are grill vents in the rooms, I reckon maybe they are still sorting out some thing as it's new. Anyway, apart from this minor issues it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid 3 star”
Reviews.Author: AllyandBob
Reviews.Content: The contemporary style of this hotel is right up our alley. The room was quite comfortable. The location is perfect, within walking distance of many of the sites and restaurants, and quite close to public transportation. The staff was very attentive, even though they always seemed quite busy.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money I ever seen (and perfect design regardless of money)”
Reviews.Author: hlib
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great budget design hotel. Crispy new and clean, flawless black and green modern design inside with military fleur. Room size and equipment adequate to price tag of 70 EUR but everything is there, design and ergonomics are well-thought through. Wi-fi is free and fast. Location is perfect - metro station is in 2 minutes, it is central business and shopping district rebuilt in last 15 years, and close to key sights. It is also very quiet at night. With 4 nights I tried new bakery/cafe for breakfast in 5-minutes proximity every morning, and have not been able to try all :) Verdict: higly recommended, nothing to complain about. Mix of Spanish creativity and German ordnung :)

Reviews.Title: “"Modern" garbage”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there for 6 nights in early September 2011, we got the smallest room available. The room had a modern feel to it, which isn't our style. Lights that take some getting used to, and never seemed to work the way we wanted. Cloth hangers which are connected to the ceiling/wall so it's very hard to use and not too practical. The little flyer in our room said there was laundry services, but when we asked about it they said they don't do it anymore. The breakfast, while not mandatory, is ridiculously expensive at 15 euro's per person, and not that good. The worst part however, comes with their little green lights in each room (or at least rooms that face outside, which looked to be about 40 or so from our side). These lights are on automatically from 7ish-11:30 (which if you're travelling around Berlin for 10 hours like we were, is very late), and are VERY bright. There is no screen on the windows, and no AC because they are a "green hotel". These lights are right next to the window, and opening the window just invites every bug you can possibly imagine, and a couple more we've never seen before. We left for dinner and came back to a nest. Closing the window just made it that much hotter in the room, and with no AC we just melted. So basically, they are a green hotel, that has at least 40 or so batteries charging these bright lights. It's like someone smoking a cigarette, yelling at another person for littering, and then flicking their cigarette stub onto the ground when their done. It's still pollution. Just because it makes you look hip and cool doesn't make you any less of a hypocrite. The location is nice yes, but there are countless more hotels in Berlin, and I'm sure with a little more searching we would of found a better option. We would never stay here again, and I would recommend others look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: hcam48
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly recommend Gat hotel Checkpoint Charlie. A contemporary hotel with modern quirkily themed decor. The staff were efficient, very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The tapas in the restaurant - delicious. The hotel was within easy walking distance of many of Berlin's most interesting sights.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and all the good things one could say!”
Reviews.Author: Rubo82
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived from my weekend in Berlin and I have to admit that I was impressed by the quality and service of this hotel. It is definetely NOT a 3 stars hotel: it is much better!! The attention you get from the staff is probably the best of hotel: friendly people, always willing to help and to make your stay as good as possible. They speak Spanish perfectly, which makes things easier for those who get trouble with languages :). Rooms are spacious and modern. Everything with a sophisticated touch, in perfect conditions and decorated with really good taste. What we paid for the superior room was really worth the money: huge room with smal living room with two sofas.It couldn't be any cleaner. Location is also unbeatable: few meters from the Checkpoint Charlie and within a walking distance to the main sights. Connection by public transport is also good: 2 minutes to Stadtmitte, which makes the connection to Schonofeld airport quite convenient (U2 to Friederichst. and then Regional train which takes 25 minutes), Breakfast is a bit expensive compared to Berlin prices. 15 € per peron is quite a lot, especially considering that there are a good amount of cafeterias in the area, where one gets a more than decent breakfast for less than 5 euro. I will definetely repeat and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Aido1982
Reviews.Content: Located very close to checkpoint charlie and the berlin wall this hotel is great value for money. It is very central, very close to the underground, only about one mile from the brndenburg gate also. It is a very modern / groovy hotel, rooms were small but very cosy. Breakfast was on the expensive side so we didnt bother getting it in the hotel we got it in the cafe up the road. If we ever go back to berlin, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sassy, =)”
Reviews.Author: Joahnna1407
Reviews.Content: What I loved about this hotel, other than it had the perfect location (accessible and close to all the major sights), was that it was just so sassy. I loved the modern, clean, fuss free take on the interiors. You have everything you need without all the fussy, cheesy and often waste of space and resource interiors. The colors just livens you up and makes you ready for a tour around town. If only the breakfast fee was more affordable, it would really be the perfect place to stay. However, the location more than compensates for this as you have cafes, restaurants, fastfoods around the area. One negative comment I have though, is that I can hear the kids from the rooms above running around. Other than those 2 comments, it is definitely a good place to stay in Berlin. =)

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice in the heart of Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Sethseth
Reviews.Content: I defiantly recommend this fresh hotel situated in one of the best areas in Berlin with walking distance to all mayor attractions in the center. The hotel is newly renovated and is really worth its name of being a design hotel. The breakfast is lovely but the area offers many cosy cafes and restaurants. The only drawback is the lack of AC. We stayed there for three nights in early Mai, meaning bearable temperatures but it must be worse during summertime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent no frills hotel - with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Lucy026NZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a double room. Room was excellent, comfortable and modern. However, a major designer flaw is the lack if air con. It was very stuffy, and we quickly learnt windows could not be left open due to mosquito problem. lack if fridge meant we couldn't keep water cold, annoying in such a hot room. €15 for breakfast does not fit in with the 'no frills' nature of the hotel, nor the €30 dinner so we ignored both options. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby, I highly recommend the Italian next door.

Reviews.Title: “No aircon, you can't be serious...”
Reviews.Author: Myanmartraveler
Reviews.Content: Already in june our room got very very hot. Can't imagine to stay there when it is really warm. The windows can be openend a tiny bit, but not enough to cool the room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little box....”
Reviews.Author: Andromeda86
Reviews.Content: As told by other reviewers, this is an exceptionally good value hotel for Berlin and very well placed. My tips would be 1) Be aware that the street it is located on splits and becomes something else for a while so when walking from Friedrichstrasse Station, keep going down Friedrichstrasse until you find Krausenstrasse on your right...that way you won't get lost, as we did! 2) It does get VERY hot in your room....but the rooms are spotless. 3)The breakfast is really good value for what you get and everyone chats to each other as you sit VERY close together! 4) Do some research on restaurants nearby before you go...there didn't seem to be that many!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if visiting the city centre”
Reviews.Author: SDB08
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel during our trip to Germany. We chose it because of its privileged location, next to the Check Point Charlie. The nearest U-bahn is Stadmitte. We booked the room through the hotel´s web site, and got a good price thanks to the early booking (30 days in advance). Our room was big enough, very clean and stylish. It faced the interior courtyard. The bathroom was nice, the only problem is that it had no shower tub, so that the floor gets a little bit flooded. There´s a computer in the lobby you can use. Loved the design of the hotel :) If you don´t want to pay for the buffet breakfast you don´t need to worry, because there are plenty of cheap places to have breakfast in Friedrichstrasse! Perfect place if it´s your first time to Berlin and are planning to visit the main attractions. If you´re more into visiting the northern quartiers like Prenzlauer Berg it may be a little bit far away.

Reviews.Title: “very cool place”
Reviews.Author: Steve-O1974
Reviews.Content: Like all of Berlin, this place is just cool. Minimalistic decor, very clean rooms and friendly staff. Conveniently located. One word of warning though: there is no air conditioning and the windows will not stay open. I had to rig the windows to stay open with my shoes and some cords...other than that, I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: AussieGreggie
Reviews.Content: We did not know what to expect of Berlin and its location. We picked this hotel from the internet as it looked very modern and trendy. I can say we were not let down. The rooms were 'fab' if that is the latest expression. The breakfast was great and the service excellent. The bar was convenient for a late night cap. The location turned up great. Not far form its namesake 'Checkpoint Charlie' and from here you get the hop on / hop off bus and see the rest of the city. Berlin is deep in history and sorry we did not spend alot of time there. looking forward to going back and will stay at the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: johnvdh
Reviews.Content: Modern and clean hotel with good service. Good design ideas and decoration details make the most of the small spaces and give a friendly human touch to the hotel The location is nice, very near the tourist-attracting checkpoint charlie, close to stylish shopping gallerias and a minute away from a metro station that connects the two central lines crossing the city. Good beds, nice bathroom with a big shower. Free wi-fi that just works. Very good breakfast. The hotel also has a restaurant (spanish-inspired menu) which is actually very good and not very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, minimalist”
Reviews.Author: inner_city_resident
Reviews.Content: This is a smallish designer hotel, on a side street. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The rooms are small and efficient, but comfortable. I didn't have the troubles that some other reviewers found, for example they had the sense to put a soap tray in the shower which not everyone does. TV channels are a bit limited. Wireless is free if flaky. The in-house tapas restaurant looks good. I had breakfast once, which was good, if pricey. No air conditioning, so it can get stuffy but not that often a problem in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “when design meets comfort”
Reviews.Author: stezimm
Reviews.Content: very good hotel, Huge and quiet room : junior suite. Huge beds very comfortable. Helpful staff. Nice breakfast. Very centrally located just next a metro station. We had a very pleasant time there it is hot in the rooms in july but as the hotel has a eco friendly policiy this is not really a bad point.The only improvement, they could have more shelves for clothes etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location location but...”
Reviews.Author: galy
Reviews.Content: Great location. You can get to many points of interest by foot. U6 is a few steps from the hotel, U2 is nearby. Actually you can walk underground between this stations. just around the corner are a few places to have breakfast - cheaper and nicer then in the hotel. some nice restaurants in the nearby area. Room was spotlessly clean. We had a superior room, so it was spacious, as was the bathroom, good water pressure in the shower. Bar and Tapas restaurant in the hotel. On the downside... NO air condition. No lobby. No cupboard in the room, just 3 small shelves and a few non movable hangers. Desk is minimalistic. Mirror in the bathroom - a narrow strip, tucked between the window and the hairdryer, made it uncomfortable for the hubby to shave. Free WiFi working erratically, and very slow. Decoration somewhat irregular, all black and green. For the money (and location), pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “First but pleasant time in design hotel”
Reviews.Author: TatianaTLSD
Reviews.Content: It was the first time in Germany. The location is great, the hotel is not big but quite comfortable. The service was excellent, the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was various and tasty. We had a good time there. And I will definitely come back. Thank you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: xinffi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Gat Point Charlie for 4 nights in April. Pros: - location, close to the Stadtmitte U-bahn station and several interesting sights - cleanliness of the hotel - breakfast buffet was excellent - very reasonable price - helpful staff - free wifi Cons: - there was no lock on the bathroom door which was a little weird, though not a problem when traveling with a friend - the wardrobe thingy with the fixed coat hangers wasn't very functional All in all, very good value for money and I definitely recommend Gat Point Charlie to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: hobart_10
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop for 4 nights, at the start of a 6 week trip in Europe. What a great start. We are quite seasoned travellers and we loved the hotel. It is well located, a walk to most of the interesting sites in Berlin and a few blocks to the centre of the city. It was however very quiet, being on a side street. It was spotlessly clean, modern and quite funky, with it's lime green, black and white colour scheme, which was carried throughout the hotel. The attention to detail was impressive and the staff were helpful and friendly. The bedroom and bathroom were not huge but quite adequate. The furnishings were pleasingly minimal so there was maximum room for a traveller's junk. The bed was very cosy and comfortable with crisp white linen. The breakfast room was a very pleasing environment for a yummy breakfast. We ate once at the restaurant and felt the meal was fairly reasonably priced and quite good. The free internet near the reception area was appreciated. There is also a great little bar off the reception area where we had a drink each evening before going out for dinner. We tried a few different wines during these nice little personally instigated happy hours. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we return to Berlin and as it is such an amazing city we would love to go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by this design hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I had to make a last-minute trip to Berlin for business, and as my flight already cost the company an arm and a leg, decided to look for an inexpensive room to compensate, it was just for 2 nights anyway. It was a little hard to find for the cab driver coming from the airport, I think it had to do with the fact that it's still new and their name can get confused with the major attraction Check Point Charlie, which is just around the corner. However, upon arrival I must say I was instantly very satisfied with the hotel, for the budget price I paid, I got a lot more for my money than I'd imagined! +trendy, light hotel (green/white/black mainly) +room was compact (I had a single room, need to bear this in mind), but had everything you needed and was clearly new and in really good shape +walking distance from Check Point Charlie, close to centre +staff was super relaxed and friendly +free wifi +nice restaurant, good healthy(!) breakfast selection -yes the room was compact, you won't trip over your stuff but you won't be dancing through your room either. This isn't a minus point for me, but I often read reviews from people who do see it as a problem

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan-from-London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gat Point Charlie shortly after it opened. The room (515) was fresh, and quite large for a city centre hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly, and the free wi-fi was appreciated. The buffet breakfast was good. The location (just near the former border crossing) was convenient for the U-Bahn station.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel with excellent Spanish kitchen”
Reviews.Author: Tekk083
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel. Everything was clean and staff were helpful and friendly. Downside was the resonance-box central part of the hotel which made it very noisy if someone decided to shout and laugh out loud. Especially when sleeping with the windows open because there is no airconditioning. On the last night we went to the Spanish restaurant and we must say it was very good food. Go there if you're staying in the Gat Point Charlie. The WiFi connection was bad on the sixth floor. But at least it was free of charge. The location is nice as well. You're 200 meters from the checkpoint charlie and 200 meters from Stadt Mitte metro station. Ideal!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: superteuch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for seeing the main tourist sites of Berlin. Check Point Charlie is at the end of the road and is no more than a minute away (turn right on the street and walk, you cant miss it.) Under Den Linden and the Brandenburg Gate are about a 10/15 minute walk away in the opposite direction. From UDL you can then easily get to the Berliner Dom and Museum Island by a 15/20 min walk in the direction of the TV tower. The hotel itself is bright and clean and although the rooms are basic and quite small, they are clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a bit pricey but you can have as much cereal, continental, fruit, toast, and cooked breakfast as you can fit in. I would recommend that rather than doing this you take a 1 min walk round the corner to the baker/cafe Thurmann which does a great breakfast and fab cakes! There is also an Ulrich supermarket 5 mins away a few streets back. If arriving by subway be mindful that there are numerous exits which (for us) was confusing and we spent 30 mins walking in a circle! Rather than getting the bus/tube, your probably better off getting the S Bhan direct from Schonenfeld to Friedrichstrasse Station, then the tube to Stadmitte.

Reviews.Title: “central and practicle”
Reviews.Author: mbarradas57
Reviews.Content: Recent hotel, very well situated, clean, confortable, people very friendly, good value for money. Recomended

Reviews.Title: “Great and modern Hotel, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: dianard82
Reviews.Content: We were some people staying at this hotel for a trade fair and I have to say that the experience was fantastic! rooms were clean, furniture very modern and stylist but functional. Weird thing: the wardrobe! it was built with some wooden pieces but it was not a proper wardrobe so if you have too much stuff to place it's going to be difficult to hang all things! Staff was very polite and friendly and the breakfast was ok. The breakfast room was not very big and sometimes you feel a little bit "pressed". However, because of its perfect location and of its cool style and staff, I really recommend this hotel! PS: if you stay in this hotel, absolutely do not go to eat to the Italian restaurant nearby, terrible people & food!

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient”
Reviews.Author: FlouncySkirt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel - based on trip advisor reviews - and found it to be everything I needed. The hotel is literally around the corner from the Stadtmitte train stop. I could walk to everything I wanted to see - the front desk had a little travel map. I simply marked an "X" as to the hotels location and set off. I booked a single room - as I was by myself - but the room could have easily slept two people. I booked the room through bookings.com - and got it for 60 euro a night. When I checked again hotels.com wanted $151. Don't know if I just booked at the right time or what but this little hotel was the perfect base for someone looking to spend a few days in Berlin. The only downside: the internet didn't work the first 2 days. If you're there just for vacation then this is no biggie but I had school work due so it was kind of important. However, on day 3 - it wokred just fine. Also, the bar in the lobby is pretty much a dead spot. Dead. As in nothing going on. At all. In short - I loved this little hotel and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: phillyndon
Reviews.Content: Staying here for a long weekend and was very happy with it. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful and gave us maps and tips for cafes and restaurants. The room wasn't huge but was clean and modern. Great walk in shower but no tea/coffee/kettle. Free wireless throughout was great too. Breakfast was great - a buffet ranging from continental salmon/cheese/bread to more British style cereal, toast and bacon/eggs. Also great selection of pastries, cake and cookies. Quite pricey at 15 E but worth the easiness. Best of all was the location, near all the main sights and tube lines but quiet and set back from the road. 24 hr shop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonJoseph85
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 stayed here for a weekend trip to berlin. We werent going for the sights, only for the beer and nightlife Found the staff very helpful when we wanted to know where to go out for the evening, and reccomended a great German restaurant called Maximillians which was around 5 minute walk away. The Friedrichstrasse was just around the corner, with good shops, designer and other wise all along the road. For those wishing to see the sights, Checkpoint Charlie is around a 2 minute walk away, and from there, there are all sorts of walking and driving tours along the old berlin wall. The rooms were quite small, but functional for our trip, as other reviews have said there isnt much wardrobe space, but what do you expect? If you are staying for the weekend it is perfect. lack of actual double beds might be annoying for those wishing to cuddle up or make love until the early hours, but you could improvise ;) Breakfast was very nice, although a short stroll (or stumble in our case!) to a local coffee house is cheaper. Taxis to nightlife are very cheap, around 5 euros so if there is a group of you it is great. Overall great hotel in great location, would stay here again when i come back to berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Overdesigned”
Reviews.Author: GerardPost
Reviews.Content: New hotel. First impression good. However, (double) room was looking cold, too much white, no pictures. Some built-in gags were impractical rather than helpful, e.g. clothes hangers were solid and immobile and made hanging clothes quite an excersise, while light switches were hidden below the light box above the bed, needed some searching. In the breakfast room the seats were benches with too much wood around where the feet were supposed to rest. Impression was that the hotel was overdesigned. On the positive side: very quite position, yet conveniently located in the middle of town, the metro was just 15- metres away. Breakfast was all right, enough choice, yet with €15 slightly on expensive side. Just outside was a bakery where breakfast could be had for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: martkie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel as a Christmas present for me, and I must say that I really had an amazing experience. The hotel is located on a very quiet street in the centre of Berlin, with a really easy access to the main attractions, and of course the Christmas markets. The Reception staff was very polite and extremely helpful, showing us directions and giving recommendations on best places to visit and to eat. On Sunday we had to extend, because our flight to Heathrow was cancelled, and that was really painless. The rooms are not very big, but just the right size for the short stay. The bathroom quite big with a wonderful, huge shower. Overally the rooms and the lobby area are quite funky - very unusual but very nice design. We went to the bar on one evening and had a deliscoius Mojito - unfortunately the bar seemed very empty and quitet, but maybe this is the time of the year. The staff was very lovely and smiley, and the drinks were also very good. The check out was as easy as check in, and again the reception staff was extremely friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friend and family, and on myy next visit to Berlin, I will definitely stay there again! Thank you to all staff!

Reviews.Title: “Between 'average' and 'very good'”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: A young, clean and funky place. The rooms are very comfortable: cool design, large beds, a complete menu with 'light options' and a good shower. We recommend the breakfast buffet. The location is really nice if you want to visit historical places (Checkpoint Charlie!), but for people on a shopping mission it is not the ultimate location: if you want to shop in the Scheunenviertel you have to walk about 35 minutes. A quicker (but boring) option is the tube from one of the stations closeby. If the ladies at the reception would have been a little bit more attentive and friendlier, I would have graded this hotel as 'very good' instead of 'average'. Come on, ladies: smile!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Vila Real de Santo Antonio, Portugal
Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in modern berlin”
Reviews.Author: MartaFerrer
Reviews.Content: modern, minimalist, fresh, clean and full of style...do we need more?? In that case, let me add its fantastic location (close to Gat Point Charlie and FriedrichStrasse, the shopping mile) and its easy access to every attraction in Berlin - in a pleasant walking distance - and to metro station. Great young staff, very welcoming...surely to repeat! And is so easy to find... just follow the path of green light!

Reviews.Title: “Different in a very cool way...”
Reviews.Author: Dazz14115
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor found this place for me...great central location. Awesome and unique minimalist style in Architecture and decorum. very comfortable. This Hotel works. I'd stay here again if ever back in Berlin. the Room Room bar was great. http://www.nevadasurveyor.com/berlin2/

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: LukeFields
Reviews.Content: Location can't be better in a quite street just of one of the main shopping streets. Close to where Check Point Charlie used to be hence the name. Metro and Taxi stop less than 100 meters. Rooms and entire hotel is modern, nice look and feel. Will stay there again when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise, surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Principessa7797
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice surprise. Modern, fresh style, great design and with everything that young traveller needs (free internet, better then colourful mini bar :)). The location is perfect, as it is close to most of the important attractions, some of them in a walking distance. Room was very nice, clean and comfortable. No smoking, though, but needed to survive! Staff is pleasant and welcome reception every time was impressive. Note: please be advised that they do not take 500 Euros bill and this can make uncomfortable situation!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: OttTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, nice clean modern rooms, friendly and helpful staff, perfect location walking distance to most main attractions or within 15 minutes by U-Bahn (station next door). Nice breakfast facility. Many restaurants and cafes nearby. I will stay at Gat Point Charlie again!

Reviews.Title: “One step beside Friedrichstrasse”
Reviews.Author: FLIEGER67
Reviews.Content: One night for business in Berlin and due to the meeting hotels fault, there was no room for me two days prior to the meeting. I decide for self service, checked the offers close to Friedrichstrasse, not far to walk to my original hotel and was pleasantly surprised. Recently opened, no thrills, but an absolutely ok for my needs design. A nice welcome at the desk, a clean and quiet room and all together B&B for less than 80.00 Euro´s. A surprise was the breakfast staff, me, pretty early there and a only spanish and english speaking girl, nothing serious for me, but maybe something special for other Berlin travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my tiny room”
Reviews.Author: ItxiSpain
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one weekend and I actually loved it. Great location, nice designed room, comfy bed, and, yes, rooms are tiny, but who needs a huge room when staying in such a city as Berlin. Really friendly staff, they printed my boarding pass and checked u-bahn and train timetables for me. Didn't have brekfast there, too expensive, but there is a nice bakery around the corner. No doubt I will book here again, next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kirsty007
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a 'design hotel'. It is a hostel, no more, in black, white & lime green. The 'superior' room was really tiny with a tiny window overlooking other windows. Luckily Berlin is amazing & there was no need to spend alot of time there. Cleanliness was dubious. The sheets were scratchy & horrible. Cost-wise it was a total rip off (considering my friends stayed at the Regent - (lovely 5 *) for only 20 euros per night more!). There was no mini bar, no other facilities & although the staff were friendly, it was not really a hotel in any way. The best thing about it was its position near check point charlie.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: fentongreen
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Berlin and cannot recommend the hotel enough. It was clean, staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was OK, I was a massive fan and though it cost quite a lot but all in all everything is great about this hotel. The bed was the best I have slept in - we had a double room which was more than big enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Txgal
Reviews.Content: Well I would not pick this hotel unless nothing else was available. My room was tiny - repeat "tiny." Fortunately I was alone in my room so I was not bumping into anyone else. The bath room was extremely tiny with just a shower. There was no counter space around the sink. My room's small window looked out on a dirty back alley. The decor was bright lime green and black. The lobby was also small and uninviting. When we asked about making reservations for a Segway tour, the receptionist said she did not have any information for a Segway tour and she could not help us. The only positive thing I can say about the hotel is that my room was clean and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant in every way”
Reviews.Author: ryan2487
Reviews.Content: I can’t recommend this hotel enough. The design is simple, functional, and easy on the eye. The reception and dining area are bright with a clean, modern style of décor. All the fittings, from the large and comfortable bed to the power shower and the flat screen TV, are of a high quality and in great condition. The rooms are spacious and immaculately clean. Linen is changed daily at a time that suits you. The staff are extremely warm and friendly, make you feel very welcome and are eager to help with anything you might need. Special mention goes to Marcelo, ever present at breakfast to ensure you have everything you need and offer tips and suggestions for your day. I would strongly recommend taking the breakfast as part of your stay. There is a wide choice of quality products from which to store up energy for long days of sightseeing. And as someone well versed in the delights of Catalan cooking, the ‘pa amb tomaquet’ (bread with olive oil and tomato) is an excellent touch. In terms of location, you couldn’t ask for better. The hotel is situated in a charming and safe neighbourhood. The main monuments around the Brandenburg gate are within easy walking distance, and the hotel is located right next to a metro station, and close to Potsdamer Platz train station. Without doubt one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in on a city break, and I would strongly recommend it to anyone. The hotel belongs to the ‘Gat Rooms’ chain which also has hotels in Paris, Lisbon and Barcelona, amongst other cities – I hope to try their other hotels soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: NZScouseLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend trip to Berlin in August 2010 and found it a very funky, modern place to stay. It was a fantastic wee hotel, really close to Checkpoint Charlie and surrounded by some lovely restaurants and cafes. It's about 15 mins walk to the Brandenburgh Gate and a nice quiet area. The rooms are very modern and clean and the staff were extremely helpful, fluent in English and lovely to deal with. Free wifi was a bonus also. Would definately recommend this hotel for a trip to Berlin. Only downside was it was a little hot at night, but I'm sure this wouldn't be a problem at other times of the year. Overall a great place!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Gat Point Charlie
HotelInfo.Address: Mauerstrasse 81 - 82, 10117 Berlin, Germany
